Interface Payment

    Transaction

    public interface Payment
extends Transaction
    Payment A payment transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • coreRecodePayment

        void coreRecodePayment(Payment[] onsetPayments)
                throws CloseValidationException
        NOTE: To recode a payment, call Payment.recodePayment(entity.Payment[]). This should only be called from the implementation of that method.

        Recodes a payment. You can only recode payments with a TransactionStatus of SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED. Offset payments cannot be recoded. Only the following can be changed when recoding a payment:

        • exposure
        • cost type
        • cost category
        • comments
        • line item cost categories

        You can only recode a payment once.

        When recoding a payment, the system creates two new payments. The first payment is known as the offset payment. The offset payment is added to the payment's bundle. An offset is essentially the same as the payment being recoded except that the system negates all of its line item amounts. The second payment is the new (recoded version) payment which is also known as the onset payment.

        The status of the onset payment, offset payment, and any offsetting reserves is set to TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTING. The status of the original payment is set to TransactionStatus.TC_PENDINGRECODE.

        Parameters:
        onsetPayments - the onset payments that the original payment is recoded to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the payment is an offset or the payment's status is not TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTING or TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTED.
        CloseValidationException

      • setAsNonEroding

        void setAsNonEroding()
        Used in rules to switch a payment to be a non-eroding payment (if it is not already so). This method ensures that the proper reserve handling behavior will be used for this payment. If the DoesNotErodeReserve property of Payment is not exposed in the UI, then this is the only way to change a payment to be non-eroding via rules.

        Important Note: This method should only be called from the Transaction pre-update rules

      • setAsEroding

        void setAsEroding()
        Used in rules to switch a payment to be an eroding payment (if it is not already so). This method ensures that the proper reserve handling behavior will be used for this payment. If the DoesNotErodeReserve property of Payment is not exposed in the UI, then this is the only way to change a payment to be eroding via rules.

        Important Note: This method should only be called from the Transaction pre-update rules

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this Payment's PaymentType is Supplement, since supplemental payments cannot be eroding

      • applyForeignExchangeAdjustment

        void applyForeignExchangeAdjustment(java.math.BigDecimal newClaimAmount,
                                    java.math.BigDecimal newReportingAmount)
        Adjusts this payment's claim and/or reporting amounts to the specified values. Such adjustments are intended for cases where better values for the amounts are determined later, after the check is created and escalated. For example, if a check is written from a claim-currency bank account, the amount actually deducted from that account's balance will be determined by exchange rates in effect at the time the check clears. This method allows, for example, the claim amount of the payment to be adjusted to reflect that amount for which the check actually cleared. Null may be passed for newClaimAmount or newReportingAmount, in which case no adjustment is made to that amount. Adjustments are distributed proportionally among the payment's line items. For example, if the payment has four line items with claim amounts of $40, $20, $10, and $10 (a total of $80), and newClaimAmount is $100, then the claim amounts will be adjused to $50, $25, $12.50, and $12.50. In this example, each claim amount was increased by 25% (equal to the total relative increase), and each new claim amount comprises the same fraction of the total as it did before the adjustment. Adjustments to the claim and reporting amounts are largely independent. When this method is called, the system must be configured in multicurrency mode and the payment must:
        • be on a check that has already been escalated and sent downstream but not been canceled or transferred
        • not have been recoded
        • not be an offset payment
        • not be part of a multi-payee (grouped) check
        Foreign exchange adjustments only affect total incurred and total paid calculations. They do not further erode reserves.
        Parameters:
        newClaimAmount - the value to which this payment's claim amount should be adjusted; if null, the claim amount is not adjusted
        newReportingAmount - the value to which this payment's reporting amount should be adjusted; if null, the reporting amount is not adjusted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is a conflict between the new, adjusted amounts and the currencies: if newClaimAmount is different from the current transaction amount and the transaction and claim currencies are the same, or if newClaimAmount is different from newReportingAmount and the reporting and claim currencies are the same, or if newReportingAmount is different from the current transaction amount and the reporting and transaction currencies are the same

      • applyForeignExchangeAdjustment

        void applyForeignExchangeAdjustment(java.math.BigDecimal newClaimAmount)
        Adjusts this payment's claim and/or reporting amounts to the specified values. Such adjustments are intended for cases where better values for the amounts are determined later, after the check is created and escalated. For example, if a check is written from a claim-currency bank account, the amount actually deducted from that account's balance will be determined by exchange rates in effect at the time the check clears. This method allows, for example, the claim amount of the payment to be adjusted to reflect that amount for which the check actually cleared.Adjustments are distributed proportionally among the payment's line items. For example, if the payment has four line items with claim amounts of $40, $20, $10, and $10 (a total of $80), and newClaimAmount is $100, then the claim amounts will be adjused to $50, $25, $12.50, and $12.50. In this example, each claim amount was increased by 25% (equal to the total relative increase), and each new claim amount comprises the same fraction of the total as it did before the adjustment. In this variant of the method, only a claim amount is specified, and an adjustment to the reporting amount is selected automatically. For example, if the reporting currency equals the transaction currency, then the reporting amount is not adjusted. If the payment's claim is in the reporting currency, then the reporting amount is adjusted to newClaimAmount. Otherwise, the adjusted reporting amount is determined by converting newClaimAmount to the reporting currency using this payment's claim-to-reporting exchange rate. When this method is called, the system must be configured in multicurrency mode and the payment must:
        • be on a check that has already been escalated and sent downstream but not been canceled or transferred
        • not have been recoded
        • not be an offset payment
        • not be part of a multi-payee (grouped) check
        Foreign exchange adjustments only affect total incurred and total paid calculations. They do not further erode reserves.
        Parameters:
        newClaimAmount - the adjusted amount for this payment in the claim currency; cannot be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if claim amount is being adjusted but the transaction currency equals the claim currency

      • canApplyForeignExchangeAdjustment

        boolean canApplyForeignExchangeAdjustment()
        Tests whether this payment can have a foreign exchange adjustment made to it. A foreign exchange adjustment can only be made if the payment has been submitted, but not voided, stopped, recoded or transferred. Also, offset payments cannot have foreign exchange adjustments made directly to them. Rather, they always just inherit the adjustment of the payment for which they are an offset. Finally, payments that are part of a multi-payee check cannot be adjusted (joint-payee checks are OK). NOTE: Foreign currency adjustments are only applicable if the system is configured for multicurrency mode. If not, this method will always return FALSE, regardless of the payment's state.
        Returns:
        true if this payment can receive a foreign exchange adjustment, else false

      • createOnsetPayment

        Payment createOnsetPayment()
        Returns a new onset payment. The onset payment is used for recoding payments or uncanceling canceled payments (i.e., issuing or clearing a voided/stopped payment) and is created by cloning this existing payment. The comments, payment type, and status fields are reset.

        This version of the method does not preserve any foreign exchange adjustments made to the original (this) payment. To create an onset payment with any foreign exchange adjustments intact, please use createOnsetPayment(boolean,boolean).

        Returns:
        the new onset payment.

      • createOnsetPayment

        Payment createOnsetPayment(boolean cloneWithForexAdjustments,
                           boolean preserveOriginalLineItems)
        Returns a new onset payment. The onset payment is used for recoding payments or uncanceling canceled payments (i.e., issuing or clearing a voided/stopped payment) and is created by cloning this existing payment. The comments, payment type, and status fields are reset.
        Parameters:
        cloneWithForexAdjustments - If true, clones the original payment as is, including any Foreign Exchange Adjustments made to the ClaimAmount and/or ReportingAmount. If false, undoes the ForEx Adjustments and returns the ClaimAmount and ReportingAmount to their values when the check was originally created. If the Payment may be edited in the UI, then "false" should be used in order to not preserve the adjustments, or else they may be misleading.
        preserveOriginalLineItems - If false, removes all TransactionLineItems from the new onset
        Returns:
        the new onset payment.

      • getOnset

        Payment getOnset()
        Returns the onset payment associated with this payment if one exists. An onset exists for payments that have been recoded, transferred, or uncanceled (i.e., voided or stopped, but then eventually issued and/or cleared)
        Returns:
        the onset payment tied to this payment if any, else NULL.

      • getOffsettingReserve

        Reserve getOffsettingReserve()
        Returns the offsetting reserve associated with this payment if one exists.
        Returns:
        the offsetting reserve tied to this payment if any, else NULL.

      • getRequiredPaymentType

        PaymentType getRequiredPaymentType()
        Checks if there is just one appropriate payment type based on a CostType and characteristics of an exposure such as its state, open reserve value, etc. For example, for a closed exposure the only appropriate payment type is "Supplement".
        Returns:
        if there is a single appropriate payment type for the given exposure and cost type, returns it. Otherwise return null.

      • isExceedsAvailableReserves

        boolean isExceedsAvailableReserves()
        Returns true if any of the payment's line items exceeds its available reserves.

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Used in the UI to determine if a given payment should be allowed. Returns true if
        • The payment does not exceed reserves OR
        • The payment's exposure is null (not set up yet) OR
        • The financials configuration allows payments to exceed reserves OR
        • The payment's paymenttype is Supplement OR
        • The given payment belongs to a manual check OR
        • The payment's exposure does not have Reserves that belong to it

        Otherwise returns false.

        Returns:
        true if the payment passed the UI-level validation tests (separate from validation rulesets) else false
        See Also:
        isExceedsAvailableReserves()

      • hasForeignExchangeAdjustment

        boolean hasForeignExchangeAdjustment()
        Tests whether this payment has been adjusted due to foreign exchange rate changes.
        Returns:
        true if this payment has a foreign exchange adjustment, else false

      • getPaymentBeingOffset

        Payment getPaymentBeingOffset()
        If this is an offset payment, retrieves the payment that is being offset. If this is not an offset payment, returns NULL.
        Returns:
        the Payment being offset by this payment, if any, else returns NULL.

      • isRecodingOnset

        boolean isRecodingOnset()

        Returns:

      • isStopVoidOnset

        boolean isStopVoidOnset()
        Tests whether this payment exists as an offset for a payment for which a stop or void was attempted but failed. Specifically, the associated check was stopped or voided through the ClaimCenter UI, but then marked as TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED or TransactionStatus.TC_CLEARED via an API call.
        Returns:
        true if this payment is an onset for a payment that failed to be stopped or voided, else false

      • isOnsetPayment

        boolean isOnsetPayment()
        Tests whether this payment is the onset for another payment.
        Returns:
        true if this payment is an onset for another payment, else false

      • getOnsetOriginPayment

        Payment getOnsetOriginPayment()
        If this is an onset payment, retrieves the payment from which this onset was originally copied. If this is not an onset payment, returns NULL.

        Note: When used in the UI, it is recommended that this method only be used from a single payment's detail screen, rather than a listview of payments or transactions, as it may require a direct query to the database to find the original payment.

        Returns:
        the Payment for which this payment is an onset, if any, else NULL

      • isRecodeable

        boolean isRecodeable()
        Only submitted payments that have not been recoded, and are not already the offset for a different payment, can be recoded.
        Returns:
        true if the payment has a status of TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTING or TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTED and is not an offsetting payment.

      • isRecoded

        boolean isRecoded()
        Tests whether this payment has been recoded.
        Returns:
        true if this payment has been recoded, else false

      • isTransferred

        boolean isTransferred()
        True if this payment has been transferred.
        Returns:
        true if the payment has a status of 'PendingTransfer' or 'Transferred'

      • isStopped

        boolean isStopped()
        Tests whether this payment has been stopped.
        Returns:
        true if the payment has a status of 'PendingStop' or 'Stopped'

      • isVoided

        boolean isVoided()
        Tests whether this payment has been voided.
        Returns:
        true if the payment has a status of 'PendingVoid' or 'Voided'

      • isSupplement

        boolean isSupplement()
        Tests whether this is a supplement payment (i.e., its payment type is 'supplement').
        Returns:
        true if this payment is a supplement, else false

      • isFuturePayment

        boolean isFuturePayment()
        Tests if this payment has a check and that check's scheduled send date is in the future.
        Returns:
        true if this is a future dated payment, else false

      • canCreateRecovery

        boolean canCreateRecovery()
        Tests whether a recovery can be created on this Payment.
        Returns:
        true if financials are editable, and this is not an offset payment

      • getFirstLineItem

        TransactionLineItem getFirstLineItem()
        Retrieves or creates the first line item in this payment's array of line-items. The line item's linecategory is set to null as a side-effect. Note that array order may be non-deterministic, so this will only have consistent behavior if there is zero or one line item.
        Returns:
        the first line item, which may be new.

      • getFirstLineItem

        TransactionLineItem getFirstLineItem(LineCategory lineCategory)
        Retrieves the first line item in this payment's array of line-items, after setting its line category. If there are no line items, then one will be created and added to the array. Note that array order may be non-deterministic, so this will only have consistent behavior if there is zero or one line item.
        Returns:
        the first line item, which may be new.

      • getValidExposures

        Exposure[] getValidExposures()
        Retrieves the complete set of valid exposures for this payment (as an array).
        1. If payment is for a manual check, then all Exposures on the claim are valid
        2. If payment is not for a manual check, then only exposures against which a payment can be made are included. This includes:
          • Exposure is closed and previous payments have been made on it
          • Exposure is open and global PaymentExceedsReserves = true
          • Exposure is open and no reserves have been created for the exposure
          • Exposure is open and has available reserves on any costtype
        Returns:
        an array of Valid exposures for this Payment.

      • isErodesReserves

        boolean isErodesReserves()
        Whether this payment should erode reserves for its ReserveLine. This property is merely the negation of the DoesNotErodeReserves property. NOTE: This property must only be set in the CheckWizard UI. Anywhere else, use setAsEroding() or setAsNonEroding().

      • setErodesReserves

        void setErodesReserves(boolean erodeReserves)
        Sets the payment erodes reserves field. NOTE: This property must only be set in the CheckWizard UI. Anywhere else, use setAsEroding() or setAsNonEroding().

      • getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount

        CurrencyAmount getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount()
        Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's claim currency amount.
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal containing the amount of the claim currency foreign exchange adjustment

      • getReservingForExAdjustmentAmount

        CurrencyAmount getReservingForExAdjustmentAmount()
        Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's reserving currency amount.
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal containing the amount of the reserving currency foreign exchange adjustment

      • getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount

        CurrencyAmount getClaimForExAdjustmentAmount(boolean useOldAmounts)
        Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's claim currency amount.
        Parameters:
        useOldAmounts - if true and the foreign exchange adjustment amount was changed, then the prior amount will be returned. If false then the current foreign exchange amount will always be returned.
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal containing the claim currency amount of the foreign exchange adjustment

      • getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount

        CurrencyAmount getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount()
        Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's reporting currency amount.
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal containing the amount of the reporting currency foreign exchange adjustment

      • getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount

        CurrencyAmount getReportingForExAdjustmentAmount(boolean useOldAmounts)
        Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's reporting currency amount
        Parameters:
        useOldAmounts - if true and the foreign exchange adjustment amount was changed, then the prior amount will be returned. If false then the current foreign exchange amount will always be returned.
        Returns:
        a BigDecimal containing the reporting currency amount of the foreign exchange adjustment

      • acknowledgeRecode

        void acknowledgeRecode()
        Acknowledges a message that this payment was recoded. Updates its status to RECODED. Updates its onset and offset to SUBMITTED.

      • setPaymentType

        void setPaymentType(PaymentType value)
        Sets the value of the PaymentType field.
